intro: Baileya perennis, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow, dandelion-like flowers and hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open plains. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive lobed shape, while its stems are erect and branching. Baileya perennis is drought-tolerant and plays a role in stabilizing soil in desert ecosystems.
